metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32923 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A correctness issue in the JIT was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 16.1, iOS 15.7.1 and iPadOS 15.7.1, macOS Ventura 13, watchOS 9.1, Safari 16.1, iOS 16.1 and iPadOS 16. Processing maliciously crafted web content may disclose internal states of the app.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
